comment: She was one of my favorite professors!! Her class requires little effort, but always fun to show up. I would take her class again if I could!
Go to class and do your work. It's that simple.

First of all - if you can skip KSU Seminar, than do so. The class is very boring. However, if you have to take it, I'd recommend taking it with Mrs. Henson. She does what she can to make sure students leave with knowledge from the class, and she attempts to liven up a boring topic as much as she can. It's an easy (but boring) A.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Mrs. Henson is by far the best professor you will take. Yes it is a seminar class but she is truly wonderful and takes care of her students. Does not ask much and is always making sure we are taken care of regardless if it is related to the course

Professor Henson is awesome! It is almost impossible not to receive an A in her class. She does extra credit, allows you to turn in work late, and the assignments are super easy. Just do the work some point in time! She is super funny, but tends to  ramble. Only out of the goodness of her soul though! Take her if you  want to heighten your GPA!

I took her for Crisis Intervention, and she is a great professor. Her lectures are interesting . If you simply study over the chapters before the test, you will be fine. Enjoyed her class and would take her again! She does take role everyday.

I had her for freshman siminar, which is a waste of a class. However, compared to others, she made this class super easy. There were weekly assignments and a few projects, none of which were difficult. There was also a research paper. Basically if you do the assignments and follow the directions you will get 100 in the class.

GREAT PROFESSOR! Loved her! Her lectures were never boring. She always managed to connect the class discussion with her own experience. She is so down to earth and is willing to help anyone with whatever it is. Her class was that one class that I would not skip because it was enjoyable.

Professor Henson is outstanding in her eagerness to teach her students. In addition, she opened our eyes to see politics as it relates to human services from different perspectives which was suitable as it was a politically vibrant year. All in all,it was a great learning experience and I would not hesitate to take any class that she teaches.

Excellent professor. Easy A, if you go to her classes. You don't really need a book, but it helps. Just listen to her, participate, and you'll do well. The exams and tests are easy! She is going out of her way to make sure you succeed, if you want it, of course. She is funny and a bit dorky. Take her!

I enjoyed her very much. She had so many interesting stories to tell. She is so funny and this was my favorite class of the semester. She is awesome and is very responsive. She is really nice and easy going.

MY 2ND TIME TAKING HER. SHE IS GREAT. LOVE HER STORIES ALTHOUGH SHE REPEATS THEM. TEST ARE NOT HARD AND SHE DOESN'T GRADE HARD. JUST DO WHAT SHE ASK AND YOU WILL BE FINE. WOULD TAKE HER AGAIN AND AGAIN.

Professor Henson is a brilliant,fabulous and altogether auspisicious teacher with a clear passion and commitment to what she does. She is a wonderful person, a great teacher, and hopefully she will serve as an inspiration to others to become great social workers. She is a role model and a great teacher...with an amusing sense of humor. :)

She's a pretty good teacher. You will have to know a lot of dates for her tests and you will have a current event paper due every other week. She talks so much that you don't know what you were talking about before. She practically reads off the powerpoint so it gets pretty boring. And if you don't follow that rules in the syllabus you lose points.
Ms. Henson is fantastic.  She is one of my favorite teachers.  She keeps the class interesting and fun.

Love Professor Henson! She was fun and very knowledgeable about @ Risk Children and Families. You will need to read the text and attendance is mandatory. Test are from the powerpoints and book. You will enjoy her stories in the field of Social Work.
